column4: Um.. What am I supposed to do now? : -- checking for gcc... gcc
checking whether the C compiler (gcc  ) works... no
configure: error: installation or configuration problem: C compiler cannot create executables.
Hey.. I keep getting this weird Gcc error when I'm trying to ./configure anything.. What should I do?
you got build-essential installed?
sudo apt-get built-essental
sudo apt-get built-essential
that should install gcc because ubuntu does not install it by default
apt-get python-devel i think
what are you trying to build anyway
for anything that is in ubuntu repo you can also do apt-get built-dep program
err sorry apt-get build-dep program
Still not making too much sense tbh :))
that will fetch all build dependencies, at leat for the version in ubuntu repos
Ah ! You pro's and your jargon :))
so if you want to build say mplayer, "apt-get build-dep mplayer" will get all dependencies(all necessary files to compile) for mplayer
unfortunaly no. but there between universe and multiverse there are not that many programs not in a ubuntu repo
Can this repo be seen somewhere, like, a list of programs that are in it?
sure. go to System->Administration-> Software Sources and enable community maintened... and prpriarety drivers for ...
sure. go to System->Administration-> and open Synaptic
Roger
if synaptic confuses you Applications -> Add/remove is much simpler
